title: How Many Calories in a Slice of Domino's Pizza?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a slice of Domino's pizza, including macros like protein and fat, plus variations and FAQs for better choices.
h1: How Many Calories in a Slice of Domino's Pizza?
assumptions: Medium hand-tossed cheese pizza, one slice (1/8 of 12-inch pizza), standard toppings, no extras.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by pizza size, crust type, toppings, and preparation; check Domino's app or site for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One slice of Domino's medium cheese pizza contains about 200 calories and 8 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a slice of Domino's cheese pizza?
faqs.a: About 200 kcal for a medium hand-tossed slice.

faqs.q: What are the macros in a Domino's pizza slice?
faqs.a: Typically 25 g carbs, 8 g protein, 8 g fat per slice.

faqs.q: Does crust type affect calories in Domino's pizza?
faqs.a: Yes—thin crust lowers to ~170 kcal, stuffed crust raises to 250+ kcal.

faqs.q: How much sodium in a slice of Domino's pizza?
faqs.a: Around 500 mg per medium cheese slice; toppings add more.

faqs.q: Are Domino's veggie pizza slices lower calorie?
faqs.a: Similar base, but veggies add minimal calories—still ~210 kcal with light toppings.
